intro: Neea itanhaensis, commonly known as the Brazilian starfruit, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and evergreen leaves. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Its fruit, which resembles a starfruit in appearance, is edible and has a mild, sweet flavor. Neea itanhaensis plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting local biodiversity.
